background.name: Lodge Berserker

_.special: A symbol of your berserker lodge

entries: You joined one of Rashemen's many berserker lodges and are indoctrinated as one of its valued members. Members consider one another part of an extended family, happily helping their fellows whenever possible. While traditionally, foreigners refer to all Rashemaar warriors as "berserkers," only members of berserker lodges are considered so within Rashemen. Each lodge has its own personality, expressed by their fighting styles and appearance. Lodge are protected by their own telthor, usually of a creature related to the lodge's name. The members of each lodge are grouped into "Fangs," elite fighting forces ready to answer the Iron Lord's call to defend the nation. Initiation rites vary by lodge but invariably require a demonstration of fighting prowess and completion of various tests such as all-night drinking contests or single handed battle against every member of the lodge. Have you joined one of the large, well-known lodges or are you a member of a small lodge few have heard of? Whatever the case, most Rashemaar look to you with respect and admiration.

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: Choose two from among {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Survival}

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: A symbol of your berserker lodge (examples include a stag horn for the Great Stag Lodge, a web embroidered cloth for the Ettercap Lodge, or a claw necklace for the Snow Tiger Lodge), a gaming set you are proficient in, a set of common clothes, and a belt pouch containing 10 gp.

entries.name: Lodge
entries: While there are many berserker lodges throughout Rashemen, some only numbering a handful of warriors, these are some of the largest and most well known. You can roll on the table below, choose a lodge from the list, or create your own.

rows: Ettercap. This lodge is popular around the Running Rocks and the High Country where climbing skills are useful. As part of their initiations, they are known to subject members to poisons of various creatures. Members often wear cloth embroidered with spider or web motifs.

Goblin. Popular among the more populated regions of Rashemen, this lodge is known for their guerrilla fighting tactics. When going into battle, Goblin Lodge berserkers frequently wear cowls made of leather or fur.

Great Stag. One of the largest lodges, Great Stag members are often the first to charge into battle, forcing their way past their allies to strike at the largest foes. Lodge members commonly carry items carved from deer antlers.

Ice Troll. This lodge is considered one of the toughest, and its members take great pride in their ability to withstand enemy attacks. They toughen their skins using strange elixers crafted by the Old Ones. When entering battle, Ice Troll Lodge members often paint their faces in shades of blue.

Owlbear. This lodge is famous for their love of firewine, feasting, and brawling. Their halls include sturdy-built furniture that can withstand their frequently violent celebrations. Often, its members wear spike studded armor to augment their grappling assaults. Their greatest warriors array themselves in cloaks festooned with owlbear feathers.

Snow Tiger. This small but fearsome lodge is known for their powerful charging attack. Many use claw bracers to great effect while fighting. Their members commonly wear necklaces, bracelets, and charms crafted from the teeth and claws of predators.

White Dragon. One the oldest and largest lodges are famous for their ability to survive the harsh winters of Rashemen. Weapons and armor made from dragon scales, teeth, and claws are carried with reverence by the most veteran members.
Wolf. The members of this popular lodge are skilled at throwing their enemies to the ground. This lodge commonly wears cloaks made of wolf fur.

entries.name: Feature: Recognized Member
entries: As a member of a berserker lodge, most common folks of Rashemen look upon you with reverence. Your presence assures a limited acceptance by the Rashemaar of any foreign companions you travel with. If you come to a community with a hall for your berserker lodge, you and your adventuring companions can expect to receive free food and lodging of a modest standard within the hall

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: Members of berserker lodges revel in its warrior culture. Competition with members and other berserker lodges is seen as a way to define status and honor. Though the Rashemi would never support a gladiatorial arena, it is not uncommon for settlements to host regular athletic competitions and brawling matches where participants pummel each other for increased respect and recognition.

rows: I loudly express my opinions for all to hear.
Talking is a waste of time. It is only actions that get things done.
If I am idle for too long, I must find a way to release my aggression.
I can control my anger even under the most difficult circumstances.
I am utterly confident in everything I say and do.
I am fascinated by the customs of people from other lands and pester them to tell me about where they come from.
Feasting. Drinking. Fighting. There are no better things in life.
I love my weapons. There, I said it.
Honor. Without honor we are nothing (Lawful).
Power. The strongest make the rules. It is known. (Evil)
Freedom. We must be free to pursue our own paths. (Chaotic)
Greater Good. Our lodge becomes greater when we help those in need. (Good)
People. Ideals are meaningless words. The people I care about are all that matter. (Neutral)
Glory. Through battle I will earn glory for my lodge and myself. (Any)
My lodge is my family. Nothing is more important than the people of my lodge.
I will be the greatest berserker in all of Rashemen.
The Red Wizards killed someone I hold dear. I will make them pay.
The spirits of the land will be here when we are gone. We must pay them respect
The Witches of Rashemen saved my family. I owe them my life.
A mysterious voice on the wind calls me to a greater purpose. I will make a difference in the lives of all I meet.
I love to drink, feast, and fight, but I don't know when to stop.
If you are not from Rashemen, you cannot be trusted.
I am willing to take risks, even if it puts others in danger.
I cannot forgive any slight and look to punish those who have done so.
The weak are not worth of my time or effort.
I don't need to make a plan, only the weak do.
